00053     enum    AccelerometerRange {
00054         AccelerometerRange_2g   =   0,
00055         AccelerometerRange_4g   =   1,
00056         AccelerometerRange_8g   =   2,
00057         AccelerometerRange_16g  =   3
00058     };
00059 
00060     enum    GyroRange {
00061         GyroRange250deg_s   = 0,
00062         GyroRange500deg_s   = 1,
00063         GyroRange1000deg_s  = 2,
00064         GyroRange2000deg_s  = 3
00065     };
00066 
00067     // Declaring an union for the registers and the axis values.
00068     // The byte order does not match the byte order of
00069     // the compiler and AVR chip.
00070     // The AVR chip (on the Arduino board) has the Low Byte
00071     // at the lower address.
00072     // But the MPU-6050 has a different order: High Byte at
00073     // lower address, so that has to be corrected.
00074     // The register part "reg" is only used internally,
00075     // and are swapped in code.
00076     typedef union accel_t_gyro_union
00077     {
00078       struct
00079       {
00080         uint8_t x_accel_h;
00081         uint8_t x_accel_l;
00082         uint8_t y_accel_h;
00083         uint8_t y_accel_l;
00084         uint8_t z_accel_h;
00085         uint8_t z_accel_l;
00086         uint8_t t_h;
00087         uint8_t t_l;
00088         uint8_t x_gyro_h;
00089         uint8_t x_gyro_l;
00090         uint8_t y_gyro_h;
00091         uint8_t y_gyro_l;
00092         uint8_t z_gyro_h;
00093         uint8_t z_gyro_l;
00094       } reg;
00095       struct
00096       {
00097         int16_t x_accel;
00098         int16_t y_accel;
00099         int16_t z_accel;
00100         int16_t temperature;
00101         int16_t x_gyro;
00102         int16_t y_gyro;
00103         int16_t z_gyro;
00104       } value;
00105     };
00106 
00107 
00108 
00109     AccelerometerRange  m_accelerometerRange;
00110     accel_t_gyro_union  m_data;
00111     double              m_forceVector;
00112     GyroRange           m_gyroRange;
00113     uint8_t             m_whoAmI;
00114 
00115 
00116 
00124     int accelerometerCountsPerG(void) const;
00125 
00133     float gyroscopeCountsPerDeg_s(void) const;
00134 
00135 
00149     int read(int start, uint8_t *buffer, int size);
00150 
00151 
00152     // --------------------------------------------------------
00153     // MPU6050_write
00154     //
00155     // This is a common function to write multiple bytes to an I2C device.
00156     //
00157     // If only a single register is written,
00158     // use the function MPU_6050_write_reg().
00159     //
00160     // Parameters:
00161     //   start : Start address, use a define for the register
00162     //   pData : A pointer to the data to write.
00163     //   size  : The number of bytes to write.
00164     //
00165     // If only a single register is written, a pointer
00166     // to the data has to be used, and the size is
00167     // a single byte:
00168     //   int data = 0;        // the data to write
00169     //   MPU6050_write (MPU6050_PWR_MGMT_1, &c, 1);
00170     //
00171     int write(int start, const uint8_t *pData, int size);
00172 
00173 
00174     // --------------------------------------------------------
00175     // MPU6050_write_reg
00176     //
00177     // An extra function to write a single register.
00178     // It is just a wrapper around the MPU_6050_write()
00179     // function, and it is only a convenient function
00180     // to make it easier to write a single register.
00181     //
00182     int write_reg(int reg, uint8_t data);
00183 
00184 };
00185 
00186 #endif // MPU6050_H
